pe":"bytes","name":"","type":"bytes"}],"name":"checkUpkeep","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"upkeepNeeded","type":"bool"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"performData","type":"bytes"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"depositCollateral","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"depositLiquidity","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"getBorrowerIndex","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"getCollateralDetailsOfUser","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"getCollateralPerToken","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"getInterestRateModelAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"user","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"getLoanDetails","outputs":[{"components":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amountBorrowedInUSDT","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"principalAmount","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"collateralUsed","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"lastUpdate","type":"uint256"},{"internalType": nction"},{"inputs":[],"name":"getVaultAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"interestRateModelAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes","name":"performData","type":"bytes"}],"name":"performUpkeep","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"repayLoan","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"s_borrowerIndex","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"borrowerIndexOfToken","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"}],"name":"s_lastAccuralTime","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"s_tokenAddressesList","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalAmountRepaid","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalBorrowed","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawCollateral","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawDeposit","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"errors":{"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"CollateralDeposited(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a user deposits collateral","params":{"tokenAddress":"The address of the token used as collateral","user":"The address of the user who deposited the collateral"}},"CollateralReleased(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of collateral released.","token":"The token address of the released collateral.","user":"The address of the user receiving the collateral."}},"CollateralWithdrawed(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of collateral withdrawn.","token":"The address of the token being withdrawn.","user":"The address of the user who withdrew collateral."}},"DepositWithdrawn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a user withdraws a deposit","params":{"amount":"The amount of the token withdrawn","tokenAddress":"The address of the token being withdrawn","user":"The address of the user who withdrew the deposit"}},"LiquidityDeposited(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a user deposits liquidity into the protocol  Note that the `tokenAddress` has to be a valid addresss supported by the procool  and the `amountDeposited`should be above zero"},"LoanBorrowed(address,address,(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bool),uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a user borrows a loan","params":{"token":"The address of the token associated with the loan loanDetails The detailed information of the loan (e.g., amount, collateral, etc.)","user":"The address of the user who borrowed the loan"}},"LoanLiquidated(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"collateralValue":"The USD value of the user's collateral.","liquidationPenalty":"The penalty amount applied during liquidation.","loanAmount":"The total outstanding loan amount at the time of liquidation.","token":"The address of the token associated with the loan.","user":"The address of the user whose loan was liquidated."}},"LoanRepaid(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"interestPaid":"The portion of the repayment that is interest.","principalRepaid":"The portion of the repayment that goes toward the original loan amount.","token":"The address of the token used for the loan.","totalAmount":"The total amount repaid (principal + interest).","user":"The address of the borrower."}},"LpTokensBurned(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a user burns LP tokens","params":{"amount":"The amount of LP tokens the user burned","user":"The address of the user who burned the lp tokens"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"borrowLoan(address,uint256)":{"custom:modifier":"isGreaterThanZero(amount) Ensures that the loan amount is greater than zero.isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token) Ensures that the token is allowed to be used for collateral deposit."},"burn(uint256)":{"details":"This function checks whether the sender has a sufficient balance of LP tokens      before proceeding to burn the specified amount using the `_burnLpTokens` function.      It reverts with a custom error if the sender has an insufficient balance.","params":{"amount":"The amount of LP tokens to be burned. Requirements: - The `amount` must be greater than zero. (Enforced by `isGreaterThanZero` modifier) - The sender must have at least `amount` of LP tokens. Errors: - `LendingPoolContract__InsufficentLpTokenBalance` if the sender's balance is less than the specified amount."}},"checkUpkeep(bytes)":{"details":"This function is used by Chainlink Keepers (or any automated service) to determine if maintenance work is needed. It loops through all borrowers and their loan tokens to find any overdue loans. If an overdue loan is found, it returns `true` with encoded borrower and token information. If no overdue loans are found, it returns `false` and empty performData. checkData Not used in this function. Included to match the KeeperCompatibleInterface.","returns":{"performData":"Encoded data containing the borrower address and token address to be used in performUpkeep.","upkeepNeeded":"A boolean value indicating whether upkeep (liquidation) is needed."}},"constructor":{"details":"this params that are passed through the contract are immutable","params":{"lpTokenAddress":"this is the addrsss of the lp token that is used to reward the users that provide the contract with the liquidity Note that the constructor throws an error if the length of the pricefeed address array is not equal to the token addresses array","priceFeedAddresses":"this is the pricefeed addreses of the corresponding token addressses","stableCoinAddress":"this is the stable coin address which is used in lending pegged against the us doller         meaning 1 stable coin == 1 $","tokenAddresses":"this is the token addresses that are recognized by the contract"}},"depositCollateral(address,uint256)":{"custom:modifier":"isGreaterThanZero(amount) Validates that the deposit amount is greater than zero.isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token) Ensures that the specified token is allowed for collateral deposit.","custom:security":"non-reentrant Ensures that the function cannot be called recursively.","details":"Allows a user to deposit collateral in the form of an ERC20 token into the contract. This function performs checks to ensure the amount is greater than zero and that the token is allowed for collateral deposits. The deposited amount is updated in both the user's collateral details and the total collateral for the token. Additionally, the token is safely transferred from the user's address to the contract address.The following conditions are verified before processing the deposit: - The deposit amount must be greater than zero, enforced by the `isGreaterThanZero(amount)` modifier. - The token being deposited must be one that is allowed for collateral, enforced by the `isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token)` modifier. - The function is protected against reentrancy attacks by the `nonReentrant` modifier.","params":{"amount":"The amount of the ERC20 token that the user wishes to deposit as collateral.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token that the user is depositing as collateral."}},"depositLiquidity(address,uint256)":{"custom:emit":"LiquidityDeposited Emitted when a successful deposit occurs.","custom:requirements":"- The `amount` must be greater than zero. - The `token` must be an allowed token for deposits. - The user must have approved the contract to spend the specified `amount` of tokens.","custom:reverts":"- `LendingPoolContract__AmountShouldBeGreaterThanZero` if the deposit amount is zero. - `LendingPoolContract__TokenIsNotAllowedToDeposit` if the token is not allowed for deposits.","details":"This function securely transfers tokens from the user's account to the contract using `safeTransferFrom`,      ensuring the user has approved the necessary funds. The function prevents reentrancy attacks using `nonReentrant`.      The deposit amount must be greater than zero and the token must be allowed for deposits.      When the pool has zero liquidity (first deposit), the user receives LP tokens equal to the deposit amount.      For subsequent deposits, the number of LP tokens minted is proportional to the deposit amount relative to the      total liquidity and the total supply of LP tokens using the formula:      - If the pool is empty or the deposit equals current liquidity:        `mintAmount = amount`      - Otherwise:        `mintAmount = (amount * totalSupplyOfLpToken) / currentTotalLiquidity`","params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to deposit.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token to be deposited."}},"getCollateralDetailsOfUser(address)":{"params":{"token":"The address of the token."},"returns":{"_0":"The amount of collateral deposited by the caller for the given token."}},"getCollateralPerToken(address)":{"params":{"token":"The address of the token."},"returns":{"_0":"The total amount of that token used as collateral across the platform."}},"getLoanDetails(address,address)":{"params":{"token":"The address of the token used for the loan.","user":"The address of the user."},"returns":{"_0":"The loan details (amount borrowed, collateral used, etc.) of the user for the specified token."}},"getLpTokenAddress()":{"details":"This is a view function that provides access to the LP token's contract address.","returns":{"_0":"The address of the LP token contract."}},"getTokenAmountFromUsd(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function retrieves the latest price feed for the specified token, and uses it to calculate how much of the token corresponds to a given USD value. The calculation uses the price feed data, and converts the USD value into the token amount, factoring in the precision settings.","params":{"token":"The address of the token to convert.","usdValue":"The amount in USD to convert into the corresponding token amount."},"returns":{"_0":"The equivalent amount of the token for the given USD value."}},"getTotalBorrowedForAToken(address)":{"params":{"token":"The address of the token."},"returns":{"_0":"The total amount borrowed for the specified token."}},"getTotalLiquidity()":{"details":"This function iterates through the list of supported tokens and sums their USD equivalent      value using the `getUsdValue` function. It provides an accurate measure of the protocol's      total liquidity.","returns":{"_0":"totalLiquidity The total value of all tokens locked in the protocol, denominated in USD."}},"getTotalLiquidityPerToken(address)":{"details":"This is a view function that provides the current total liquidity value.","returns":{"_0":"The total liquidity in the pool, represented in the respective token's smallest unit."}},"getUsdValue(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function fetches the latest token price from the associated Chainlink price feed      and calculates the equivalent USD value. It assumes the price feed provides data in a      standard format with appropriate decimals.","params":{"amount":"The amount of the token for which the USD value is required.","token":"The address of the token whose USD value needs to be calculated."},"returns":{"_0":"The USD value of the specified token amount, with additional precision applied. Requirements: - The token must have a valid price feed available in `s_priceFeed`. - The price feed must return a valid and non-negative price."}},"getUserBalance(address,address)":{"details":"This is a view function that retrieves the user's deposit balance from the storage mapping `s_depositDetailsOfUser`.","params":{"token":"The address of the token for which the user's balance is requested.","user":"The address of the user whose balance is being queried."},"returns":{"_0":"The user's deposited balance for the specified token."}},"getValueOfLpToken()":{"details":"The value of one LP token is determined using the formula:      `valueOfLpToken = totalLiquidity / ILpToken(lpToken).totalSupply()`      This function assumes that the total supply of LP tokens is greater than zero to avoid division by zero errors.","returns":{"valueOflpToken":"The current value of one LP token in terms of the underlying asset."}},"performUpkeep(bytes)":{"details":"This function is triggered by Chainlink Keepers (or other automated services) when `checkUpkeep` signals that upkeep is needed. It decodes the borrower and token from the `performData`, checks if the loan is overdue, and if so, calls the `liquidate` function.","params":{"performData":"Encoded data containing the borrower's address and the token address, produced by `checkUpkeep`."}},"repayLoan(address,uint256)":{"custom:example":"Suppose Alice borrowed 100 USDT using 150 USDT worth of ETH as collateral. After 1 month, her total debt (due to interest) is 110 USDT. - If she repays 50 USDT, 10 goes to interest, 40 reduces her principal (now 60 USDT). - If she repays 110 USDT, her debt is cleared and her ETH collateral is unlocked. - If she tries to repay more than 110 USDT, the function reverts (overpayment not allowed).","custom:reverts":"If the repayment amount exceeds the total loan amount (principal + interest).","custom:security":"Non-reentrant and amount/token validity enforced through modifiers.","details":"This function facilitates the repayment of a loan by a borrower. Loans are recorded with      both principal and interest components. Interest is calculated using a dynamic borrow index      that simulates interest accumulation over time, and this index is updated before repayment.      Here's how the process works in this function:      1. Interest Accrual:         First, we ensure the interest is up-to-date by calling `_accuredInterest(token)`.         This updates the borrow index and ensures fairness in interest tracking.      2. Loan State Extraction:         We fetch the current loan details of the caller for the specified token, including the         principal amount borrowed and the borrow index snapshot saved during borrowing.      3. Scaled Loan Calculation:         Using the current global `s_borrowerIndex[token]` and the user's stored index,         we calculate how much the total owed amount has grown due to interest.         This is done via: `scaledLoanAmount = principal * currentIndex / userIndex`.      4. Interest Breakdown:         The difference between the scaled amount and the original principal is the interest accrued.         This interest must be paid first before reducing the principal.      5. Repayment Handling:         - If the user repays less than the interest owed, the entire payment goes to interest.         - If they repay more, excess goes to reducing the principal.      6. Loan Update:         The loan record is updated accordingly. If the full amount is repaid, the collateral         that was locked is released back to the user.      7. Emission:         Two events are emitted:         - `LoanRepaid` for tracking how much was paid, how much went to interest, and how much to principal.         - `CollateralReleased` if the entire loan was cleared.","params":{"amount":"The amount the borrower wants to repay.","token":"The ERC20 token address representing the borrowed asset (usually a stablecoin like USDT or USDC)."}},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"details":"Checks if the user has enough collateral deposited before allowing the withdrawal. Updates the user's and contract's collateral records and transfers the tokens back to the user.","params":{"amount":"The amount of the token the user wants to withdraw.","token":"The address of the token to withdraw."}},"withdrawDeposit(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function ensures the user has a sufficient deposit balance before proceeding with the withdrawal.      It uses `safeTransfer` to securely transfer the tokens from the contract to the user.      The function prevents reentrancy attacks using the `nonReentrant` modifier.","params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens the user wishes to withdraw. Requirements: - The `amount` must be greater than zero. (Enforced by `isGreaterThanZero` modifier) - The `token` must be an allowed token for deposits. (Enforced by `isTokenApprovedByTheContract` modifier) - The user must have a sufficient deposit balance to cover the withdrawal amount. Errors: - `LendingPoolContract__AmountShouldBeGreaterThanZero` if the amount is zero. - `LendingPoolContract__TokenIsNotAllowedToDeposit` if the token is not supported. - `LendingPoolContract__InsufficentBalance` if the user attempts to withdraw more than their available balance. Events: - Emits `DepositWithdrawn` upon a successful withdrawal.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token to be withdrawn."}}},"stateVariables":{"ADDITIONAL_PRICEFEED_PRECISION":{"details":"Precision factor used in price feed calculations"},"LIQUIDATION_THRESHOLD":{"details":"Represents 80% (0.8 * 1e18 precision) threshold; if collateral value falls below this, the loan can be liquidated."},"LTV":{"details":"The Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio used in the system"},"PRECISION":{"details":"The precision factor used for calculations involving token amounts or decimals"},"borrowers":{"details":"the array of borrowers"},"i_stableCoinAddress":{"details":"address of the stable coin which the protocol supports"},"lpToken":{"details":"address of the lptoken contract"},"s_amountBorrowedInToken":{"details":"Maps a token address to the cumulative borrowed amount in that token."},"s_borrowerIndex":{"details":"This index is used to calculate the compounded interest for each borrower of a specific token. Each time interest is accrued, this index is updated to reflect the cumulative interest growth. The individual borrower's interest can be calculated using the difference between the current index and the index at the time of borrowing."},"s_collateralDetails":{"custom:structure":"mapping(user => mapping(token => collateralAmount))","details":"Stores the collateral amount for each user per token"},"s_depositDetailsOfUser":{"custom:structure":"mapping(user => mapping(token => amount))","details":"Mapping to track deposited token amounts per user"},"s_isBorrower":{"details":"checking whether the user has any active loans"},"s_lastAccuralTime":{"details":"This is used to determine how much time has passed since the last interest update for a specific token, which is essential for calculating how much new interest should be added to the borrower's debt. Interest accrual operations refer to this timestamp to keep interest calculations accurate and consistent."},"s_liquidity":{"details":"the total liquidity locked in the protocol at the moment for a particular token"},"s_loanDetails":{"custom:structure":"mapping(user => mapping(tokenAddress => LoanDetails))","details":"Tracks loan details for each user per token"},"s_loanTokensForTheUser":{"details":"Maps a user address to an array of token addresses they have borrowed against."},"s_lockedCollateralDetails":{"custom:structure":"mapping(user => mapping(token => lockedCollateralAmount))","details":"Stores the locked collateral amount for each user per token"},"s_priceFeed":{"details":"mapping the token addresses to the pricefeed addresses"},"s_tokenCollateral":{"custom:structure":"mapping(token => totalCollateralAmount)","details":"Tracks the total collateral deposited for each token"},"s_tokenDetailsofUser":{"custom:structure":"mapping(user => lpTokenAmount)","details":"Stores the LP token balance of each user"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"CollateralReleased(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when collateral is released back to the user after loan repayment or liquidation."},"CollateralWithdrawed(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a user withdraws their collateral."},"LoanLiquidated(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a user's loan is liquidated due to insufficient collateral."},"LoanRepaid(address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a borrower repays their loan."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"LTV()":{"notice":"This constant defines the LTV ratio as 75%, represented with 18 decimal places (75e16)"},"PRECISION()":{"notice":"This constant defines the precision (1e18) for scaling values to match token precision or to avoid precision loss"},"burn(uint256)":{"notice":"Burns a specified amount of LP tokens from the sender's balance."},"checkUpkeep(bytes)":{"notice":"Checks if any borrower's loan has passed its due date and requires liquidation."},"depositCollateral(address,uint256)":{"notice":"This function emits a `CollateralDeposited` event once the deposit is successfully made. The event contains the user's address, the token address, and the amount deposited."},"depositLiquidity(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows users to deposit ERC20 tokens into the lending pool and receive LP tokens in return."},"getCollateralDetailsOfUser(address)":{"notice":"Returns the amount of collateral a user has deposited for a specific token."},"getCollateralPerToken(address)":{"notice":"Returns the total amount of a specific token deposited as collateral by all users."},"getLoanDetails(address,address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the loan details of a specific user for a given token."},"getLpTokenAddress()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the LP token contract."},"getTokenAmountFromUsd(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Converts a USD value into the corresponding amount of tokens."},"getTotalBorrowedForAToken(address)":{"notice":"Returns the total amount borrowed for a specific token."},"getTotalLiquidity()":{"notice":"Calculates the total value locked (TVL) in the protocol."},"getTotalLiquidityPerToken(address)":{"notice":"Returns the total liquidity available in the lending pool."},"getUsdValue(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the USD value of a specified token amount using its price feed."},"getUserBalance(address,address)":{"notice":"Returns the deposited balance of a specific user for a given token."},"getValueOfLpToken()":{"notice":"Calculates and returns the current value of one LP token in terms of the underlying asset."},"performUpkeep(bytes)":{"notice":"Performs the upkeep by liquidating overdue loans."},"repayLoan(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a borrower to repay their outstanding loan, either partially or in full."},"s_borrowerIndex(address)":{"notice":"Tracks the index representing the total interest factor for each token across all borrowers."},"s_lastAccuralTime(address)":{"notice":"Records the last timestamp when interest was accrued for each token."},"s_tokenAddressesList(uint256)":{"notice":"the approved list of tokens the contract accept to trade"},"totalBorrowed()":{"notice":"the total amount of loan given by the protcol in USD"},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to withdraw a specified amount of their deposited collateral."},"withdrawDeposit(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows users to withdraw their deposited tokens from the lending pool."}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/LendingPoolContract.sol":"LendingPoolContract"},"evmVersion":"cancun","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":chainlink-brownie-contracts/=lib/chainlink-brownie-contracts/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":halmos-cheatcodes/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/halmos-cheatcodes/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/"]},"sources":{"lib/chainlink-brownie-contracts/contracts/src/v0.8/automation/interfaces/AutomationCompatibleInterface.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf504b227c442cd4ed31b336b7bd15cfcb23220c84c26e750975c7e7d959125aa","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://34e35eb46dfadf12396e92dd970547209dfd99f0ae5b1ec7b5a3e81617f620a1","dweb:/ipfs/Qmanoi2CDi9MwkP44HosagvewfMEvCMN1YthGRmCexVjwY"]},"lib/chainlink-brownie-contracts/contracts/src/v0.8/shared/interfaces/AggregatorV3Interface.sol":{"keccak256":"0x257a8d28fa83d3d942547c8e129ef465e4b5f3f31171e7be4739a4c98da6b4f0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6d39e11b1dc7b9b8ccdabbc9be442ab7cda4a81c748f57e316dcb1bcb4a28bf9","dweb:/ipfs/QmaG6vz6W6iEUBsbHSBob5mdcitYxWjoygxREHpsJHfWrS"]},"lib/forge-std/src/console.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4bbf47eb762cef93729d6ef15e78789957147039b113e5d4df48e3d3fd16d0f5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://af9e3a7c3d82fb5b10b57ca4d1a82f2acbef80c077f6f6ef0cc0187c7bfd9f57","dweb:/ipfs/QmR9VzmnBDJpgiDP6CHT6truehukF9HpYvuP6kRiJbDwPP"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/Ownable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xff6d0bb2e285473e5311d9d3caacb525ae3538a80758c10649a4d61029b017bb","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8ed324d3920bb545059d66ab97d43e43ee85fd3bd52e03e401f020afb0b120f6","dweb:/ipfs/QmfEckWLmZkDDcoWrkEvMWhms66xwTLff9DDhegYpvHo1a"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IERC1363.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd5ea07362ab630a6a3dee4285a74cf2377044 :/ipfs/QmY63jtSrYpLRe8Gj1ep2vMDCKxGNNG3hnNVKBVnrs2nmA"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd6fa4088198f04eef10c5bce8a2f4d60554b7ec4b987f684393c01bf79b94d9f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f95ee0bbd4dd3ac730d066ba3e785ded4565e890dbec2fa7d3b9fe3bad9d0d6e","dweb:/ipfs/QmSLr6bHkPFWT7ntj34jmwfyskpwo97T9jZUrk5sz3sdtR"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x982c5cb790ab941d1e04f807120a71709d4c313ba0bfc16006447ffbd27fbbd5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8150ceb4ac947e8a442b2a9c017e01e880b2be2dd958f1fa9bc405f4c5a86508","dweb:/ipfs/QmbcBmFX66AY6Kbhnd5gx7zpkgqnUafo43XnmayAM7zVdB"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11a5a79827df29e915a12740caf62fe21ebe27c08c9ae3e09abe9ee3ba3866d3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3cf0c69ab827e3251db9ee6a50647d62c90ba580a4d7bbff21f2bea39e7b2f4a","dweb:/ipfs/QmZiKwtKU1SBX4RGfQtY7PZfiapbbu6SZ9vizGQD9UHjRA"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8891738ffe910f0cf2da09566928589bf5d63f4524dd734fd9cedbac3274dd5c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://971f954442df5c2ef5b5ebf1eb245d7105d9fbacc7386ee5c796df1d45b21617","dweb:/ipfs/QmadRjHbkicwqwwh61raUEapaVEtaLMcYbQZWs9gUkgj3u"]},"src/LendingPoolContract.sol":{"keccak256":"0x09d9b40205af82c6c670049d27e8dadba961e3547b3dbdb754bc75f326eed77d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://23a3b5f5204755e405ae744597bed6836bdb38f7cde9eba32599de539684ba52","dweb:/ipfs/QmX45MSvv1fHi1oSbWbcpJTGY7RVhgYS4U6WK5ysT6co7S"]},"src/Vault.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3472a92d5d9d4aa2a41d3f36055f9d819015af013aec3a557736d00185dc8012","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://e47cb8d167e25527a4e695dbe2b28da79b53f953b842e44de4ff2cc6958fe55d","dweb:/ipfs/QmYYBuo8uknZDxxw7QVg2bDVfShZPVSPxwNuxgWakvG4Ud"]},"src/errors/Errors.sol":{"keccak256":"0xcc5b9e64b2e7dfcf53bfacfc599edc6f6ab44ff3a9d97fd042253b35a531fe4c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://17ecfdae44a53bb26f88870c89cc6ab7c170e772d9b2d4d4424d437f11a41eac","dweb:/ipfs/QmYMZEtx7EeaB9RwMGHBNyHj6PA7RWYifBzL56AVba5k5m"]},"src/interfaces/IInterestRateModel.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0e53c6f3181c65b8b1275f541d52efc6aa631e4e603c94354a8f4560ab26981c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5faec73c4beefb215d0f2b195e7efe9b1228afb044b297e60fa4f281ff3dbe07","dweb:/ipfs/QmeKKubaMryESDFgwD857RcuiKozqdw9MwYcqnKNY25cRF"]},"src/interfaces/ILendingPoolContract.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6e36195072acf5a074a1ee820da431ba9a93bafc95988fe62792f0e2cf10b74f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://425643b4cc73f9d15f7ef78d0c7a4a78c5a6fc22fc487b25b3401736758b79a6","dweb:/ipfs/QmSBqvTdwJgXnoPX7BSLwxSZsJWtkdMYuoaCmB4e6JWzk7"]},"src/interfaces/ILpToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8336d373ac2bc46caacfd1adeb7047e720a96ad29dcb642061433502a73f1ae3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c1077fa7843ae7caa65742dcd65e47d7a33c4ff513897ca9c80af761dafded4b","dweb:/ipfs/QmUysXDRpxwkLvf6dhVff8eDSLLKLTyaob92dNXtNFkJQf"]},"src/interfaces/IVault.sol":{"keccak256":"0x469556b881c2ba78842daab4a6b2ddca9d2ce5a5ba5583121d348d50d0fb0dc7","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3ce00070fdf9175370aa4892c31d3bb0d623e7ab4a6e434232f8e5bc9c159fba","dweb:/ipfs/Qmd5XECcwWD6RjwxkkH9ycpWgcwSLUQKChsLU4YZibtca8"]},"src/tokens/LpTokenContract.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5830cc3ac07cd0d93bef53fe3c466ae4b20e32b4d165460aab32005b849fbc8d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ef1a21da568c1a4805b246c92bf16b57bfed7e399bea01253a130ae4efced68e","dweb:/ipfs/QmVNLQpTyFEgN6QRCi3TVxLcCobKfkbuWSsq6HZ8hYWfpA"]},"src/tokens/StableCoin.sol":{"keccak256":"0x486811fc5fce2f5c6c458b5fde2402c6e1f208e4cb8eb20629d784e61f12926f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://4662a64fc4e662ad883cb2ecebc4c020824110828a45886d0693d2fb6e1477b6","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf8a5rPLVcb2VpUVLViq3XKCuB9viCfF3ymQpZxnuJV7u"]}},"version":1}

borrowLoan(address,uint256).custom:modifier: isGreaterThanZero(amount) Ensures that the loan amount is greater than zero.isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token) Ensures that the token is allowed to be used for collateral deposit.

burn(uint256).details: This function checks whether the sender has a sufficient balance of LP tokens      before proceeding to burn the specified amount using the `_burnLpTokens` function.      It reverts with a custom error if the sender has an insufficient balance.

params.amount: The amount of LP tokens to be burned. Requirements: - The `amount` must be greater than zero. (Enforced by `isGreaterThanZero` modifier) - The sender must have at least `amount` of LP tokens. Errors: - `LendingPoolContract__InsufficentLpTokenBalance` if the sender's balance is less than the specified amount.

checkUpkeep(bytes).details: This function is used by Chainlink Keepers (or any automated service) to determine if maintenance work is needed. It loops through all borrowers and their loan tokens to find any overdue loans. If an overdue loan is found, it returns `true` with encoded borrower and token information. If no overdue loans are found, it returns `false` and empty performData. checkData Not used in this function. Included to match the KeeperCompatibleInterface.

returns.performData: Encoded data containing the borrower address and token address to be used in performUpkeep.
returns.upkeepNeeded: A boolean value indicating whether upkeep (liquidation) is needed.

constructor.details: this params that are passed through the contract are immutable

params.lpTokenAddress: this is the addrsss of the lp token that is used to reward the users that provide the contract with the liquidity Note that the constructor throws an error if the length of the pricefeed address array is not equal to the token addresses array
params.priceFeedAddresses: this is the pricefeed addreses of the corresponding token addressses
params.stableCoinAddress: this is the stable coin address which is used in lending pegged against the us doller         meaning 1 stable coin == 1 $
params.tokenAddresses: this is the token addresses that are recognized by the contract

depositCollateral(address,uint256).custom:modifier: isGreaterThanZero(amount) Validates that the deposit amount is greater than zero.isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token) Ensures that the specified token is allowed for collateral deposit.
depositCollateral(address,uint256).custom:security: non-reentrant Ensures that the function cannot be called recursively.
depositCollateral(address,uint256).details: Allows a user to deposit collateral in the form of an ERC20 token into the contract. This function performs checks to ensure the amount is greater than zero and that the token is allowed for collateral deposits. The deposited amount is updated in both the user's collateral details and the total collateral for the token. Additionally, the token is safely transferred from the user's address to the contract address.The following conditions are verified before processing the deposit: - The deposit amount must be greater than zero, enforced by the `isGreaterThanZero(amount)` modifier. - The token being deposited must be one that is allowed for collateral, enforced by the `isTokenApprovedByTheContract(token)` modifier. - The function is protected against reentrancy attacks by the `nonReentrant` modifier.

params.amount: The amount of the ERC20 token that the user wishes to deposit as collateral.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token that the user is depositing as collateral.

depositLiquidity(address,uint256).custom:emit: LiquidityDeposited Emitted when a successful deposit occurs.
depositLiquidity(address,uint256).custom:requirements: - The `amount` must be greater than zero. - The `token` must be an allowed token for deposits. - The user must have approved the contract to spend the specified `amount` of tokens.
depositLiquidity(address,uint256).custom:reverts: - `LendingPoolContract__AmountShouldBeGreaterThanZero` if the deposit amount is zero. - `LendingPoolContract__TokenIsNotAllowedToDeposit` if the token is not allowed for deposits.
depositLiquidity(address,uint256).details: This function securely transfers tokens from the user's account to the contract using `safeTransferFrom`,      ensuring the user has approved the necessary funds. The function prevents reentrancy attacks using `nonReentrant`.      The deposit amount must be greater than zero and the token must be allowed for deposits.      When the pool has zero liquidity (first deposit), the user receives LP tokens equal to the deposit amount.      For subsequent deposits, the number of LP tokens minted is proportional to the deposit amount relative to the      total liquidity and the total supply of LP tokens using the formula:      - If the pool is empty or the deposit equals current liquidity:        `mintAmount = amount`      - Otherwise:        `mintAmount = (amount * totalSupplyOfLpToken) / currentTotalLiquidity`

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token to be deposited.

returns._0: The amount of collateral deposited by the caller for the given token.
The total amount of that token used as collateral across the platform.

params.token: The address of the token used for the loan.

returns._0: The loan details (amount borrowed, collateral used, etc.) of the user for the specified token.

getLpTokenAddress().details: This is a view function that provides access to the LP token's contract address.

returns._0: The address of the LP token contract.

getTokenAmountFromUsd(address,uint256).details: This function retrieves the latest price feed for the specified token, and uses it to calculate how much of the token corresponds to a given USD value. The calculation uses the price feed data, and converts the USD value into the token amount, factoring in the precision settings.

params.token: The address of the token to convert.
params.usdValue: The amount in USD to convert into the corresponding token amount.

returns._0: The equivalent amount of the token for the given USD value.
The total amount borrowed for the specified token.

getTotalLiquidity().details: This function iterates through the list of supported tokens and sums their USD equivalent      value using the `getUsdValue` function. It provides an accurate measure of the protocol's      total liquidity.

returns._0: totalLiquidity The total value of all tokens locked in the protocol, denominated in USD.

getTotalLiquidityPerToken(address).details: This is a view function that provides the current total liquidity value.

returns._0: The total liquidity in the pool, represented in the respective token's smallest unit.

getUsdValue(address,uint256).details: This function fetches the latest token price from the associated Chainlink price feed      and calculates the equivalent USD value. It assumes the price feed provides data in a      standard format with appropriate decimals.

params.amount: The amount of the token for which the USD value is required.
params.token: The address of the token whose USD value needs to be calculated.

returns._0: The USD value of the specified token amount, with additional precision applied. Requirements: - The token must have a valid price feed available in `s_priceFeed`. - The price feed must return a valid and non-negative price.

getUserBalance(address,address).details: This is a view function that retrieves the user's deposit balance from the storage mapping `s_depositDetailsOfUser`.

params.token: The address of the token for which the user's balance is requested.
params.user: The address of the user whose balance is being queried.

returns._0: The user's deposited balance for the specified token.

getValueOfLpToken().details: The value of one LP token is determined using the formula:      `valueOfLpToken = totalLiquidity / ILpToken(lpToken).totalSupply()`      This function assumes that the total supply of LP tokens is greater than zero to avoid division by zero errors.

returns.valueOflpToken: The current value of one LP token in terms of the underlying asset.

performUpkeep(bytes).details: This function is triggered by Chainlink Keepers (or other automated services) when `checkUpkeep` signals that upkeep is needed. It decodes the borrower and token from the `performData`, checks if the loan is overdue, and if so, calls the `liquidate` function.

params.performData: Encoded data containing the borrower's address and the token address, produced by `checkUpkeep`.

repayLoan(address,uint256).custom:example: Suppose Alice borrowed 100 USDT using 150 USDT worth of ETH as collateral. After 1 month, her total debt (due to interest) is 110 USDT. - If she repays 50 USDT, 10 goes to interest, 40 reduces her principal (now 60 USDT). - If she repays 110 USDT, her debt is cleared and her ETH collateral is unlocked. - If she tries to repay more than 110 USDT, the function reverts (overpayment not allowed).
repayLoan(address,uint256).custom:reverts: If the repayment amount exceeds the total loan amount (principal + interest).
repayLoan(address,uint256).custom:security: Non-reentrant and amount/token validity enforced through modifiers.
repayLoan(address,uint256).details: This function facilitates the repayment of a loan by a borrower. Loans are recorded with      both principal and interest components. Interest is calculated using a dynamic borrow index      that simulates interest accumulation over time, and this index is updated before repayment.      Here's how the process works in this function:      1. Interest Accrual:         First, we ensure the interest is up-to-date by calling `_accuredInterest(token)`.         This updates the borrow index and ensures fairness in interest tracking.      2. Loan State Extraction:         We fetch the current loan details of the caller for the specified token, including the         principal amount borrowed and the borrow index snapshot saved during borrowing.      3. Scaled Loan Calculation:         Using the current global `s_borrowerIndex[token]` and the user's stored index,         we calculate how much the total owed amount has grown due to interest.         This is done via: `scaledLoanAmount = principal * currentIndex / userIndex`.      4. Interest Breakdown:         The difference between the scaled amount and the original principal is the interest accrued.         This interest must be paid first before reducing the principal.      5. Repayment Handling:         - If the user repays less than the interest owed, the entire payment goes to interest.         - If they repay more, excess goes to reducing the principal.      6. Loan Update:         The loan record is updated accordingly. If the full amount is repaid, the collateral         that was locked is released back to the user.      7. Emission:         Two events are emitted:         - `LoanRepaid` for tracking how much was paid, how much went to interest, and how much to principal.         - `CollateralReleased` if the entire loan was cleared.

params.amount: The amount the borrower wants to repay.
params.token: The ERC20 token address representing the borrowed asset (usually a stablecoin like USDT or USDC).

withdrawCollateral(address,uint256).details: Checks if the user has enough collateral deposited before allowing the withdrawal. Updates the user's and contract's collateral records and transfers the tokens back to the user.

params.amount: The amount of the token the user wants to withdraw.
params.token: The address of the token to withdraw.

withdrawDeposit(address,uint256).details: This function ensures the user has a sufficient deposit balance before proceeding with the withdrawal.      It uses `safeTransfer` to securely transfer the tokens from the contract to the user.      The function prevents reentrancy attacks using the `nonReentrant` modifier.

params.amount: The amount of tokens the user wishes to withdraw. Requirements: - The `amount` must be greater than zero. (Enforced by `isGreaterThanZero` modifier) - The `token` must be an allowed token for deposits. (Enforced by `isTokenApprovedByTheContract` modifier) - The user must have a sufficient deposit balance to cover the withdrawal amount. Errors: - `LendingPoolContract__AmountShouldBeGreaterThanZero` if the amount is zero. - `LendingPoolContract__TokenIsNotAllowedToDeposit` if the token is not supported. - `LendingPoolContract__InsufficentBalance` if the user attempts to withdraw more than their available balance. Events: - Emits `DepositWithdrawn` upon a successful withdrawal.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token to be withdrawn.

LTV().notice: This constant defines the LTV ratio as 75%, represented with 18 decimal places (75e16)

PRECISION().notice: This constant defines the precision (1e18) for scaling values to match token precision or to avoid precision loss

burn(uint256).notice: Burns a specified amount of LP tokens from the sender's balance.

checkUpkeep(bytes).notice: Checks if any borrower's loan has passed its due date and requires liquidation.

depositCollateral(address,uint256).notice: This function emits a `CollateralDeposited` event once the deposit is successfully made. The event contains the user's address, the token address, and the amount deposited.

depositLiquidity(address,uint256).notice: Allows users to deposit ERC20 tokens into the lending pool and receive LP tokens in return.

getCollateralDetailsOfUser(address).notice: Returns the amount of collateral a user has deposited for a specific token.

getCollateralPerToken(address).notice: Returns the total amount of a specific token deposited as collateral by all users.

getLoanDetails(address,address).notice: Retrieves the loan details of a specific user for a given token.

getLpTokenAddress().notice: Returns the address of the LP token contract.

getTokenAmountFromUsd(address,uint256).notice: Converts a USD value into the corresponding amount of tokens.

getTotalBorrowedForAToken(address).notice: Returns the total amount borrowed for a specific token.

getTotalLiquidity().notice: Calculates the total value locked (TVL) in the protocol.

getTotalLiquidityPerToken(address).notice: Returns the total liquidity available in the lending pool.

getUsdValue(address,uint256).notice: Returns the USD value of a specified token amount using its price feed.

getUserBalance(address,address).notice: Returns the deposited balance of a specific user for a given token.

getValueOfLpToken().notice: Calculates and returns the current value of one LP token in terms of the underlying asset.

performUpkeep(bytes).notice: Performs the upkeep by liquidating overdue loans.

repayLoan(address,uint256).notice: Allows a borrower to repay their outstanding loan, either partially or in full.

s_borrowerIndex(address).notice: Tracks the index representing the total interest factor for each token across all borrowers.

s_lastAccuralTime(address).notice: Records the last timestamp when interest was accrued for each token.

s_tokenAddressesList(uint256).notice: the approved list of tokens the contract accept to trade

totalBorrowed().notice: the total amount of loan given by the protcol in USD

withdrawCollateral(address,uint256).notice: Allows a user to withdraw a specified amount of their deposited collateral.

withdrawDeposit(address,uint256).notice: Allows users to withdraw their deposited tokens from the lending pool.
